context_meta.author: third_watch
context_meta.title: Japan Air Sets Sights on AirAsia's Turf for First Low-Cost Route
context_meta.summary: Japan Airlines Co. has decided to go head-first into the home turf of Asia’s largest low-fare carrier. The Japanese operator, which is starting its own budget carrier next month, will begin flying to Southeast Asia initially, Masaru Onishi, a director at Japan Airlines, said in an interview in Sydney Monday. Japan Airlines will compete with Sepang, Malaysia-based AirAsia Group Bhd., whose businesses include affiliates in Indonesia, the Philippines, Thailand and Vietnam.

context_meta.author: rocky.j.mountain
context_meta.title: Rail staff `bearing brunt of service cancellations anger´
context_meta.summary: Rail staff are continuing to bear the brunt of passengers' anger over delays and cancellations to services, a union has warned. The Rail, Maritime and Transport union (RMT) said its members have faced abuse since new timetables were introduced last month. The anger continued on Monday, especially on Northern, where an emergency timetable was launched, said the union. General secretary Mick Cash said: “From the feedback on the ground and the stream of comments on social media it is clear that the so-called emergency timetables on both Northern and Govia Thameslink Railway (GTR) have just piled failure onto failure. “Once again it is RMT members at the sharp end, bearing the brunt of public anger

context_meta.author: DeltaBravo
context_meta.title: Man moving deer from road fatally struck by vehicle
context_meta.summary: Wheatland Township, Mich. — An 85-year-old man was struck and killed by a vehicle as he attempted to remove a deer carcass from a central Michigan roadway. The Mecosta County sheriff's office said Norman Erickson of Barryton was a passenger in another vehicle that stopped after hitting the deer about 11 p.m. Saturday in Wheatland Township, northeast of Grand Rapids. A 22-year-old motorist from Marion was traveling southbound on the road when she struck Erickson. Sheriff's deputies said the accident is under investigation.

context_meta.author: rocky.j.mountain
context_meta.title: China to take aim against diesel vehicles in new smog push: China Daily
context_meta.summary: SHANGHAI (Reuters) - China will crack down further on diesel consumption and support using rail for freight deliveries in its ongoing fight against pollution, the official China Daily said on Monday, citing an environment ministry report. Diesel trucks accounted for just 7.8 percent of China's total vehicles, but contributed as much as 57.3 percent of the country's total nitrogen oxide emissions, the report said, citing data from the Ministry of Ecology and Environment. The crackdown will strengthen scrutiny on fuel and engine quality and restrict car freight, it said. As part of its war on pollution, China took more than 20 million outdated vehicles off the roads over the last five years, and

context_meta.author: captainunderoos
context_meta.title: Global airline body warns against protectionism, rising costs
context_meta.summary: Trade wars and protectionism are key risk factors to airline profits already weakened by rising oil prices, the International Air Transport Association said Monday. The warning came at the annual meeting of global airlines in Sydney, where it was revealed that 2018's collective net profit was forecast to be $33.8 billion, down from an outlook of $38.4 billion released in December. The lower figure, while still considered healthy for the sector, reflected the impact of soaring oil prices which have hit 3.5-year highs following the US pullout from the Iran nuclear deal and unrest in Venezuela.

context_meta.title: Bud Cauley sustains serious injuries in car accident
context_meta.summary: The golfer suffered a collapsed lung, five broken ribs, and a fractured leg.

context_meta.author: rocky.j.mountain
context_meta.title: Traffic advisory: Part of S.R. 434 in Oviedo closed as crews repair three-foot-wide hole
context_meta.summary: A heavily traveled road in Oviedo is shut down after an old drainage pipe that crosses underneath the road caused a three-foot-wide hole Saturday evening, according to the Florida Department of Transportation. Engineers closed a section of State Road 434, just south of Black Hammock at Laurel Oaks Court, FDOT spokesman Steve Olson said. FDOT is still trying to figure out how to fix the pipe and repair the hole, so the road will remain closed until then. This section of roadway accommodates an average of 19,000 vehicles per day, according to the transportation department. A detour was set up by FDOT so drivers can use Tuskawilla Road and Red Bug Lake/Mitchell Hammock Roads as alternate routes.

context_meta.author: DeltaBravo
context_meta.title: Ford's Two-Wheel Concept Car Gets a Chinese Electric Makeover
context_meta.summary: The two-wheeled vehicle whizzing around a Beijing test track is a mashup of motorcycle, electric car and space capsule, wrapped around the brain of a smartphone. Inspired by a Ford Motor Co. concept car from 1961 that used gyroscopes to stay upright, Zhu built a streamlined version that resembles an escape pod from a science-fiction movie. Beijing Lingyun Intelligent Technology Co. plans to build the gyrocar itself and may pick a domestic location for its factory this month, with a goal to start sales in 2020.

context_meta.author: DeltaBravo
context_meta.title: Woman killed by suspected drunk driver in Escondido
context_meta.summary: An allegedly-drunk driver struck and killed a woman crossing a street in Escondido early Sunday, police said. Paramedics took a 32-year-old woman to Palomar Hospital with two broken femurs, as well as multiple internal and head injuries, Kearney said. Witnesses told police a Ford Ranger had been traveling west on Washington Avenue while the woman and a male companion were crossing the street. The driver of the ranger swerved to avoid the man and instead struck the female victim, witnesses said.

context_meta.title: British tourist 'sent flying' as he films planes on Greek island
context_meta.summary: A man stood filming planes take off on the Greek island of Skiathos got the shock of his life when the powerful thrust of an aircraft's engines knocked him off his feet.  Paul Turner from Cheshire is responsible for capturing the remarkable footage of a Thomas Cook passenger plane — an Airbus A321-231 — taking off at Skiathos Airport. As the plane accelerates along the runway, Turner's camera suddenly pans skywards as he is sent flying by the sheer force of the carrier jet's turbines. Scroll down for video  Powerful gusts from the jet's engines causes vegetation to wave wildly as the plane starts to accelerate up the runway The spot Turner was filming is a hit among tourists for plane-watching

context_meta.title: Stop train delays or forget salary hike & promotions, Railways tells top officials
context_meta.summary: NEW DELHI: In what should come as a relief to railway passengers frustrated by delays in services, trains are now likely to run on time as any deviation from the schedule will cost officials of the national transporter their promotions. Railway Minister Piyush Goyal has warned heads of zonal railways that delays in train services will defer their appraisal proportionately, giving them a month to improve punctuality. During an internal meeting last week, Goyal lashed out at zonal general managers and said that they cannot hide behind the pretext of maintenance work to explain delays in train services, a senior railway ministry source told PTI. context_meta.title: Man suffers serious injuries after car is 'deliberately driven at him'
context_meta.summary: A man suffered serious injuries when a vehicle was deliberately driven at him in a picturesque Surrey village. Surrey Police said the hit-and-run occurred around 7.45pm yesterday in Hersham, a leafy stockbroker belt where house prices average more than £600,000 according to RightMove. The 27-year-old victim suffered internal injuries, fractured ribs, and a dislocated shoulder when he was hit by the car in the Longmore Road area. He has undergone surgery and remains in hospital in serious condition. Surrey Police are appealing for witnesses in a bid to piece together what happened and say the victim is not currently not assisting them with their enquiries.  Detective Constable Hannah Clarke, who

context_meta.title: 1 killed, another hurt as sports car turns turtle near Kolkata
context_meta.summary: A man was today killed and his friend seriously injured when the sports car they were travelling in hit a divider and turned turtle at Domjur area of Howrah district. The vehicle, which was coming at a high speed from Dankuni, hit the divider while approaching a bridge on National Highway 6 at Domjur, an hour's drive from Kolkata, and landed upside down on the ground with a thud, a senior police officer said. "Prima facie it seems that Shibaji Roy, a man in his early 30s, was driving the car. His friend Ashna Surana (21) was seated next to him," he said. Both of them were pulled out of the mangled vehicle by local people with the help of police officers. "While Roy was declared dead on his arrival

context_meta.title: Footage shows high-speed police chase in which cars smashes into HGV
context_meta.summary: Dashcam footage has emerged of a high speed police chase in which a stolen car slams into a HGV before its passengers get out and are chased on foot by officers. The shocking footage of the chase near Leighton Buzzard, Bedfordshire was recorded on a HGV's dashcam and has just been released to the public despite it taking place in January 2016.   The footage which is around 1min10sec long shows the HGV being overtaken at high speed by a stolen silver Vauxhall Corsa. context_meta.author: DeltaBravo
context_meta.title: I drove an electric car for the first time under intense conditions — and it performed surprisingly well
context_meta.summary: I drove an electric vehicle, a Chevy Bolt, for the first time on an autocross course. The Bolt's acceleration wasn't remarkable, but it handled well. I felt like it was always under control, even when I pushed it into a series of hard turns. I came away with a positive impression of the Bolt. Almost none of the maneuvers required by the course would apply to everyday driving, but the course demonstrated how the Bolt could hold up in unusual circumstances. A Chevy Bolt is not the first car you might think to use on an autocross track. Autocross is a timed competition in which cones are arranged, often in a flat and spacious environment like a parking lot, to create a course that tests a driver's

context_meta.author: nanook
context_meta.title: Full-Size Luxury for a Mid-Size price: The 2018 Genesis G90
context_meta.summary: So, what does $70k get you from Genesis? To start, you get a beautifully styled sedan with an extra-long, 124-inch wheelbase and a 75-inch-wide track, all with a progressive design. The side profile reminds me a lot of the Bentley Flying Spur. Large 19” wheels come standard to enhance its stance which give the vehicle a grand presence as you approach it. At night you will notice LED accent lights accompanied by auto leveling heads that light up the road ahead seamlessly. Your entry into the vehicle is illuminated by the Genesis logo — a subtle reminder of what awaits. The luxurious accoutrements also made the G90 quite enjoyable to drive.
